intro: Bromus molliformis var. tunetanus, commonly known as the Tunetan bristlegrass, is a perennial grass species native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features slender,丛生 stems with fine, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are loosely arranged, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
